p:
Compared to petroleum-based particles, nanocelluloses possess relatively high thermal stability and insulation properties,
31 which can be attributed to their density, width, and cross-sectional area
32 and the orientation of the crystalline axis. Nanocelluloses are also chemically resistant to the vast majority of organic solvents.
33 Concurrently, both nanocellulose and lignins undergo degradation through biochemical pathways.
34 Moreover, their biodegradability highlights an effective solution to current problems that are otherwise faced when using, for instance, latexes that in the long run pose environmental concern.
